reviews.review_msg: I highly suggest taking notes for all readings and videos since quizzes are open book and it saves time by already being prepared. Also, the paper was difficult given that the marking criteria is very specific and grading is tough, but follow feedback to a tee and it'll raise your grade in the final revision. Alys herself is a decent prof.

EASIEST CLASS EVER! please do yourself a favour and take this class. You get 80% of your mark for just simply handing stuff in, doesn't even have to be good. Lectures were boring but it was worth it for the easy GPA booster. Online final, what more do you need. only thing you have to really do is write 1 essay which you also get marks for doing.
I actually really liked this professor. She grades really harsh, but she teaches content well and I feel like I really learned from her!
Take the class with any other prof but her

The award for the worst prof of all time goes to Alys Avalos-Rivera. Her grading criteria are so unclear, you'd have better luck decoding ancient hieroglyphs. And when you email her with a question, you'll get a full essay in return, everything except the actual answer you needed. Take this course with any other prof but her.
Do not take any class with Dr. Avalos-Rivera.
Watch out don't do it. Impossible to do well!!!

The final paper was worth 30% and was graded very harshly, which brought my grade down a lot - Prof randomly picked some people and marked their papers. Lectures are long and boring, and most of the stuff taught is common knowledge, so this could be an online course. Some marks are given for participation only, so that helps bring your grade up.

There is no way of getting an A in this class no matter how hard you try. Attending office hours with the TA was way more helpful than with the prof. The major assignments are difficult to understand and quizzes are not easy because the textbook itself is a hard read. I would recommend taking this class with any other prof to save you the trouble.
The worst prof ever

This class was not at all what I signed up for, I hated every last second of it. This is the lowest grade I have ever gotten and for being a 100 level English course this class is marked down to an unnecessarily low grade. This tanked my GPA for zero reason and none of the content was even beneficial. I recommend taking LITERALLY ANY OTHER CLASS!!!
definitely the rudest prof at sfu

the worst prof ever! do not take her unless you want to lower your GPA. she is so particular with what she wants leaves no room for creative liberty. i'm in my last semester and this class is ruining my GPA because of how difficult it is (it is my hardest class and i'm in 3 other 400 level classes!)

This professor grades you like you've been writing research proposals since the day you were born. TA and prof never answer emails. Feedback is vague and laughable because it looks like they didn't even read your assignment. TA will give you suggestions and if you implement them, prof will take marks off because you didn't do your assignment right

This course was one of the most difficult, boring and unhelpful class I have ever taken at SFU. The prof and TA were very hard to contact and barely responded to emails or messages. I strongly advise you to get engl credits from a different class because you will NOT succeed in this class, good luck :)

This course was the worst class I've taken here at SFU. There was no guidance in the class, the professor was not helpful at all and showed no care for her students. The feedback was vague, research paper itself is a whole chunk of the course and it made no sense. The quizzes were fine, but is not a big chunk of the mark.

Average must be hovering around 60% for this class. Feedback given on papers is condescending and makes you feel stupid. She is a horrid educator and only inspires you to do the bare minimum as you can't achieve better regardless of how hard you try. Professors should be encouraging but Dr. Rivera chooses to do the opposite and demean her students.

I went to office hours to get help with a big assignment and she took a look at my content and assisted me. She then gave me a 70% on it and in one section her feedback was that it looked like I haven't thought very much about how to write it. Girl make it make sense??? I literally went to you for help and you told me how to write it?????
id give her a 0 if i could. SFU administration really should look into why she has a review average this low. please avoid her

You have a higher chance of winning the lottery than getting anything above 80% in this class. Marking make 0 sense, doesn't answer your questions, do exactly what she tells you to do and you'll still get 70% with minimal feedback. Taking her class is like the worst form of torture possible

She says your work is excellent and then proceeds to give you a 60% on major assignments. With the minimal feedback she gives you just makes no sense especially since you did exactly what she told you to do. She's an English prof yet can't write proper email yet she expects you to write like you're Shakespeare. Don't take her.
Someone tell me why mbb331 is easier than this course by a considerable margin? Never got an evaluation lower than 90 in that class. Still yet to break 75 in this one. Egregiously harsh.

I know that rate my prof is inaccurate often, but I cannot stress the accuracy of the reviews of this prof. Terrible assignments with extremely vague criteria, with extremely harsh grading. Raising your grade with organic chemistry or calculus is easier than getting a major assignment higher than 60 percent in this course. Good luck.
she drastically changed the course from last semester to this one. what was a b+ average is now presumptively a c+. horrrrrrrribllllllleeeeee

if you want her to drop your gpa, if you love unfair marking, if you love failing, if you love having a bad prof Alys Avalos-Rivera is your best friend. The worst prof at this school absolute garbage of a prof. I have good As in all my other English class other than this one. She makes me wanna question my sanity. Makes me wanna drop out.

All the reviews are right about her. She grades unfairly, marks extremely hard, and gives low grades even when she says your work is great. Doesn't answer questions and clearly favors certain students over others. She doesn't want students to succeed. Should be fired and banned from teaching. Don't take her.
ah yes. if i wanted my child to teach english, grade in the most unfair way possible, and teach everything unrelated to course assignments, i would name them alys avalos-rivera.

I have an A or an A- in all my other SFU upper-level English courses. I am set for a B in Alys's ENGL 470W class. She takes marks off for the most nitpicky of things in amounts that do not make sense. Many of the activities we did in groups in her class had nothing to do with the course overall and seemed like make-work just for the heck of it.

She is one of the worst profs ever her grading scale is whack does not make any sense and if not willing to give out good marks. I didn't check her reviews and I should've cause it would've saved me from this mental abuse and my GPA. Her lectures are boring as and her quizzes are unfair, she doesn't give you enough time. Worst class ever stay away

All the reviews about her are correct. She is unfair to her students and she definitely has favorite. You're graded on few things and she marks extremely hard and does not want you to do well. Just don't take her.
all the other reviews perfectly describe her
There is a huge language barrier and her methods are not very practical or reasonable.

All the other reviews are very true about her and her demeanour. She wants students to not do well, she is also very sassy and answers questions in the most condescending way. She does not deserve to be teaching at ANY University.

Terrible professor. She will do everything she can to make sure you don't get a good grade. She should be fired and banned from teaching. What everyone else is saying is true. Just avoid her at all costs.
worst prof

Not good. Instructions are incredibly confusing, and the subject is just so dry and boring. Even if you do manage to follow it exactly you still end up with less than 60% and its worth 45% and 35% of your grade. The only upside is that the lectures are 15-20 mins. She wants her students to fail lol
This prof will make instructions confusing and if you ask her for clarification, you will end up even more confused. Beware!!! listen to all the 1 ratings and don't take any course with her.

She states in the syllabus "Only a few exceptional students whose work is above average are granted a grade higher than B". Alys expects her students to already be experts in what she teaches. If a student passes her class with an A+, they should be outright given an English degree as that is the level you must write at to achieve that grade.

Avoid this professor at all costs. Lectures are very monotone, boring and not very relevant. She doesn't care about the effort her students put into assignments and doesn't want them to succeed. Quizzes and readings do not relate to major assignments and students are expected to know how to complete assignments perfectly with minimal guidance/help
definetly the worst prof at sfu
to save yourself from unwanted frustration, do not take a course with this prof.
worst prof at sfu
dude jsut stay away form her
just look at the ratio between 5 and 1 ratings she has

This professor is extremely difficult and has a harsh grading style that feels unnecessarily strict. She doesn't seem invested in her students' success and can be unapproachable when it comes to answering questions
fr tho, how is she still teaching? she will answer questions in the rudest way possible and is just overall not helpful.
she makes me regret every minute of my life I waste in her lectures

Don't take her. Terrible prof, she shouldn't be teaching at all, don't understand how she still hasn't been fired yet. She basically told our class that don't expect to do well in this course because she won't be giving out good grades.
just stay away from her.
I dont understand how people like her are allowed to teach. Havent seen a more condescending prof ever.
The rating speaks for itself. Hands down the worst prof at SFU. Don't take her.
rudest prof ever.
The average rating speaks for itself. She wants students failing her class

One of the worst the prof ever. Assignment instruction is unclear, does not want her students to succeed, does not care about her students, get ready to fail the class even if you try, lots of reading, and boring lectures. Save your money, time, and sanity. Just don't take class, actually the worst prof at SFU.

She's genuinely the worst professor in this university who disregards any hard work you put into your assignments and all of her lecture videos are a waste of time. If you're considering taking this course just because it's online, stay away and just take it in person if you want to have a good grade in this class.
Must I say more? Stay away if you enjoy fair grading. Wouldn't recommend her to my worst enemy. She has bad rating even in schools from the US. Will she ever learn?

As you can already tell by her rating, she is arguably the worst prof out there. She does not want you to succeed in her class and is a crazy hard marker for no reason. Basically, wants you to fail her class and does not want to answer your question then complains about how no one asks questions.  Stay far away from her as possible.
She is an awful professor, as you can already tell from her rating. I recommend that everyone avoid her.
horrible, stay away
this prof makes the class very boring

lectures is just yap but very very easy participation/completion marks. Instructions and material is unclear and unorganized. teacher gives you "second" chances but doesn't grade fairly. Got 0.1 off of a B but she wouldn't round it whatsoever and said she gave me enough opportunities to get a good grade

doesn't give good feedback, just criticism. the content of her lectures made no sense, majority of assignments are easy marks except the only 3 big projects (paper outline, paper draft and final copy) she gives an additional 2 day grace period without any penalty for almost every assignment that needs to be handed in
She doesn't know what she is doing. She is very uninspiring and boring. Please avoid!
worst prof of all time!
The lectures were very boring and often seemed unorganized. Prof was just reading off the slides most of the time.
avoid this prof
Worst English professor at SFU! Please avoid her if you care about your grade, time and money. It's such a waste of both.

She claims to give free marks for weekly assignments, but grades on essay drafts and finals are intentionally lower. In most English courses, 10% comes from attendance and participation (easy mark), but in this one, missing weekly assignments hurts your grade. The highest essay draft grade I heard of was 60%, and the instructions are vague. AVOID!!
Made the course very difficult for no reason
sooooo boring
Very unorganized lectures. Pretty much just reading from slides, not engaging at all.
avoid this prof if possible.

Overall a very easy course. 60% of your grade is based off completion and participation, the final project which is worth 30% and the final exam worth 10%. The final is online and you can refer to your own notes. There were in class bi-weekly quizzes but you had 2 chances to redo them at home. Just show up and do your work, and you'll get an A.

Got 0.1% below the next letter grade, with no opportunity to change it. Can't really complain because, yes, I could have 'just done better', but apparently, this happened to many students. Felt like she needed a quota for x number of each letter grades, so made some of us suffer. Not the hardest class, bit unorganized. It seems like she's trying.

Worst English professor who doesn't know how to teach. Very unorganized and demotivating. She prevents her students from succeeding in all possible ways. Inspiring students with good grades is the last thing she wants to do. She offers courses to crash student's GPAs that's her only goal!! Be aware!

Extremely disorganized course content, which fails to actually give a student an understanding on what the course is about. "Language and Purpose" had no clear purpose. Feedback which was supposed to be given to help the final paper draft was not given until AFTER the draft was submitted, giving no time to actually fix the paper. Genuinely horrible
Smh do not take
not sure how she is a professor. Never made sense what was going on during class.
Lectures are a waste of time. She spends hours on stuff that should take 15 mins max
Letting anyone be a prof these days
Honestly so boring
Hated lectures
All the rating she has received shows what her classes are like. She makes the most boring and unorganized lectures. Also is very rude
Mean professor
Worst teacher at sfu
Never take
Worst class with worst prof I have taken
Unorganized and very boring. Seems like prof gets power trips just cuz she's teaching 100 students lol. Do not take a class with her. Grading is just setting you up for failure.
unprofessional, many notes and posts weren't posted and materials needed for work was not given in time to effectively work on assigments.

The assignment instructions were often unclear, making it difficult to understand expectations and achieve good grades. The professor seemed to make the course unnecessarily difficult without ensuring the quality of the content. Please avoid her by any means.

She seems nice, but I honestly didn't enjoy her teaching style. Grading criteria was clear, however the instructions for projects was super confusing, and asking her for clarification just made things worse. The group projects felt unnecessary, and often didn't have much relation to the big solo projects. The lectures were WAY too long!
No clear instructions to do good. just don't take this course. good luck.

ENGL199W is the most useless class I have ever taken. It is full of work that is assigned just for the sake of doing work. The prof has unclear and convoluted instructions that are full of typos, and the textbook (which is also a horrendous piece of writing) is mandatory for about half the coursework. Avoid this class at all costs.

Do not take this class with this prof. Just don't. I am a straight A/B student and this class took me for a wild ride. Her instructions are so unclear & the material just doesn't make sense. I emailed her several times and her responses were not helpful whatsoever. Just do not do it. It's not worth it.

This class stressed me out so much. I am only one month in and wish I could drop it. You MUST follow the instructions to a T unless you want to lose marks. Instructions are unclear at times. Assignments are confusing and the hard thing is if you mess up, it impacts your grade greatly. When asked questions, answers are unhelpful and confusing.

Alys is a lovely lady who is quite knowledgable in her field. Her seminars are run very nicely. Her style of lecturing is different from others at SFU, but nonetheless, she is kind and caring, and provides ample opportunity to make easy marks via attendance and low-stress in-class activities.
Horrible don't take this class

If you can avoid this prof I would. Treats a first year class like a fourth. Really needs to rethink her syllabus. Almost everyone in the class STRUGGLED. For your sake, stay away. She also has this annoying contract if you are late or miss any assignments you have no chance to get a grade higher than a B.
horrible prof for 199W

I think anyone and everyone should not take her English 199W class. She is a mice prof but she cannot teach. For the sake of your grade stay away from her. Also didn't learn much English at all, boring lectures, and just talks to herself in class as no one has the attention span to listen to her talk for 2 hours straight

Tutorial attendance is mandatory. MC final. There is no curve or scaling in this class at all so do not rely on it. Random participation quizzes in class. Essay is graded heavily make sure to focus on ethos pathos stuff. Class is kinda boring tho and you probably won't understand anyth cuz she takes 2hrs to read like 10-15 slides. Stressless course

Took her last sem in 114 and now again in 199, and both times were mistakes. Just because i didnt use the right font and 1 less source she gave me a 50% on an assignemnt worth 30% of ur entire grade. I literally gained no english knowledge from this course. Do not recommend this prof

For 199w- she requires to use a  tracking changes tool on word. The tracking tool just makes it easier for the prof and TA to read the final paper a lot faster and easier. It also makes edits visible. Which imo is incredibly stupid as we used to hand in physical papers. Gave me 37 percent for having the tool and refused to read the paper.

In-person ENGL 199;
1Expects a first year student to write a research paper with her horrible instructions. She needs do a better job of explaining. 
2If you miss more than 1 class say bye to your B grade - the way she grades
3.Hard marker but gives good feedback
4.If you need to take this class, In all honesty DO NOT take it with her.
5.word limit
ABSOLUTLY HORRIBLE PROF. TALKS FOR HOURS STRAIGHT DOESNT EXPLAIN PROPERLY. I THINK I LOST BRAIN CELLS TAKING THIS CLASS WITH HER

She's pretty sassy which makes her lectures entertaining. I like how she uses Menti towards to end of class so we could ask her questions anonymously. The textbook is also a comic which is pretty cool too. The final essay is a bulk of your grade but you'll be able to work on it throughout the course. TAs do take attendance during tutorials.

The lectures are VERY boring, and are mandatory since she makes you do mini assignments for participation during the lecture which are very easy. The essay is worth half of your grade which sucks. The textbook was comic style and a easy read. Final exam was okay, allowed a cheat sheet, however make sure your clear on the topics taught.
Acts nice in lectures but unprofessional during online meetings. Overall, a very boring class.

Alys isn't too bad. What I didn't like is that your final essay is worth 45% of your grade and the final is 15%. Also, lectures are 2 hours long and she reads directly off her slides and doesn't do much to keep you engaged so it was pretty boring and hard to listen and sit through. If you read the textbook and do your work then you'll be fine.

I enjoyed this course a lot. She's friendly, sweet, caring and reasonable. Going to lectures and doing the readings is important in this course becasue there were sometimes quizes in the lecture material, which are pretty easy. As long as you go to lectures, put a good amount of effort in and ask for help when you need it you should be fine.

(ENGL 371) I'm kind of shocked at how low Dr. Avalos-Rivera's score is. She is the sweetest prof ever, and her assignments are not that hard if you put genuine time and effort into them. I didn't really like how participation was worth a lot less than the presentation and the portfolio, since we spent a lot of time on the smaller assignments.

(for engl 199): Very tough grader but does include good feedback. Uses some-what unprofessional language when giving feedback (meaning sassiness). takes 5x the amount of time needed to explain the material. she has literally 20 slides but takes 3 hours. never gives clear yes/no answers to yes/no questions.I had to take the class

ENGL 199W (not an option??): 
For first years with no research article writing experience you have to figure some things out alone (lit review, etc.), she's a really hard marker but gives great feedback when she does. No homework really just a research article to write worth 60% total. In-class activities help boost grade a bit.

Alys obviously tried to do her best with very dry material. Unfortunately I didn't learn alot from this class as I already knew a fair bit about academic writing. However, the course load was light and if you show up and do the work, you'll be fine.

She seemed so sweet at first but then was so abrupt and inconsiderate near the end of the course. She got mad at people randomly too. Her lectures are boring and her accent makes it difficult to understand her sometimes.

ENGL 199- The material is dry and linguistically heavy, but if you are willing to put the work in and really try and follow the material she provides, your academic writing will improve. She is also really caring and puts a ton of effort into marking your work. While this wasn't my favourite class of all time, I definitely learned a lot.

She makes things due during lecture so attendance is important. She does her best with the course material which she even stated was dry (it was). Even with a pretty disrespectful class, she maintained her focus and was very willing to help with any confusion.
So many mini assignments which weigh so heavily if misses. This is a 100 level course but she treats it like a 400

Basic english course that is actually useful as it focuses on writing rhetorically. Lots of mini assignments to boost your grade. Only 1 major research paper in this course that is worked on as the semester progresses. Overall, a helpful course that can enhance your writing abilities.

prof nice you can tell she tries her best. tons of mini assignments during class, tutorials, at home etc., one overall paper that is dragged out and made step by step. exam is reasonable m/c but based on writing analysis (be prep to read and recognize) and TB content (allowed a cheat sheet). overall nice but time consuming:)

A little disorganized what she says doesnt always line up with the criteria sheets or outlines, which is annoying. A lot of tasks but that makes it easier to get a good grade. None of the tasks are especially hard, instructions just arent always clear. But the skills taught in the class are definitely useful.

She LOVES to ramble. She said her students fall in her lectures and I understand why. Her lectures are hard to follow since she adds so much fluff. Lack of cohesiveness. Her accent also makes it a little hard to understand too. Weekly tasks and journal entries based on the readings. Lectures are recorded but good luck trying to decipher her words.
